abstract: Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s approval of Prime Min Ahmet Davutoglu’s interim government allows pro-Kurdish party lawmakers to hold ministerial posts for first time in Turkey’s history; appointments are not expected to survive November 2015 snap election.
lead_paragraph: The prime minister assigned the interim government, which includes cabinet ministers from a pro-Kurdish party for the first time, until elections on Nov. 1.

headline.main: Erdogan Approves Caretaker Government in Turkey

snippet: The prime minister assigned the interim government, which includes cabinet ministers from a pro-Kurdish party for the first time, until elections on Nov. 1.
